column4: Is there a way of viewing previous copy/pastes in the clipboard in ubuntu 10.10 if you haven't installed anything previously to do exactly that?
I think zeitgeist does that but not sure

ActionParsnip: Are these something that would've need to be installed already? Or do they come stock? I just copies over something very important I need so I need one back. I know that there is software that will keep a history. But I'm wondering if gnome keeps it somewhere alrewady.
is this 11.04..yes?
Ubuntu 10.10
there is also something named  "diodon"  clipboard manager,, not in the repositories however
https://launchpad.net/~diodon-team/+archive/stable
Once again though, this would've had to be already on the machine. Correct?
well that PPA  is for installing that particular application... off hand I cant think of something already onboard for this but let me check
Yeah. I need something that I just copied over. So it would be one copy into the history of the clipboard. I'm thinking it should still be in gnomes memory or something somewhere.
yeah I think something might have to be installed glipper  or diodon,, so far i cant find a way to display that history
shnikes. That's what I'm afraidof.
looking to see if there is a not well know command hold on
Thanks. I've been searching for 30 mins. Can't find anything.
there is also this   http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/tag/clipboard/
nope,, I cant find anything other than parcelite,, diodon,, glipper and that link I gave you
sorry guy
Thanks. Well there goes an hours worth of work in one keystroke thanks to basecamp.
Time to install a pastebin history tool
I think that may be a good idea,, but I am still looking
mm  I think that is beyong my skillset,, if no one can answer here you can also try the ##linux channel
Thanks. I was looking for a an alt room as well. I tried #ssh but there were only 2 other people in there.
